1_1E178zyyVE38UQJQ68CDwMSeGYcqLbnVXX.body:
I want to see if I have this figured out.
Your id is associated with a permanent public key [1], which is generated from a private key [1]. This private key isn't designed to be human readable.
Your id is associated with a temporary public key [2], which is generated from a private key [2]. This private key is designed to be human readable.

To confirm your identity you can sign a message with either private key.

At any point in time you can update your public key [2] to a new value, as long as you sign the update message with your private key [1].

So the purpose is to gain the usability of having a human readable key, while still keeping some of the security of having a non human readable key.
